intro: Cynoglossum birkinshawii, commonly known as the Welsh poppy, is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is native to the United Kingdom. It is a herbaceous perennial plant that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant features distinctive blue or violet flowers with five petals, arranged in a bell-shaped form. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in well-drained soils in full sun to partial shade. It is often found in grasslands and woodland edges, contributing to biodiversity in its native habitat.
